# Drone News 48h Brief — December 29, 2025

_Window: last 48 hours; 19 incidents._

## Summary
In the past 48 hours, multiple drone incidents have raised significant concerns about prison security breaches and air traffic disruptions across various locations. Notably, several news reports describe incidents in which drones delivered items to inmates in different prisons, highlighting ongoing smuggling issues. These incidents occurred near Adelaide and various other unknown locations. Additionally, there were widespread disruptions at Moscow airports and Hanover Airport due to drone activities, affecting flight operations significantly. Policies addressing drone regulations are being revised in China amid increasing incidents related to unauthorized drones. These incidents underline the risks posed by drones not only in prisons but also in sensitive airspace areas, prompting discussions on tighter regulations and responses to drone-related threats.

**By category:** airport: 4 • arrest: 1 • crash: 1 • interference: 1 • other: 5 • smuggling: 5 • terrorism: 2
**Top queries:** drone security breach (5), drone illegal (4), drone airport disruption (3), drone incident (3), drone arrest (1)
